column4: is there any suitable player to play *.avi,*.mp3,*.DAT,*.mpeg,*.wma on ubuntu ?
i used MPlayer , but when i open mplayer , it is playing with full screen mode and i couldnt return to my desktop
any idea ?
which player r u using to play .dat,.wav,.wma,.mpeg..avi ?
ctrl+d
also
i dont kow why mplayer doesnt want to return to my desktop
try hitting "f"
linux uses as much memory as possible - this is a Good Thing (tm) - look at the "free" entry on the second line of the command output from   free -m  to see a more useful figure
free -m <enter>  in Apps - accessories - terminal :)
yeah i see it uses a lot od my mem, i need to run a virtual machiune and with 1 gig its not working well
442 in caqche
the second line ( buffers and cache - what is under the free column?
no, how much is "free" in the second line? That 's the relevant figure
then you effectively have 855 MB free
the rest is mostly biffers and cache
so i can give my virtual machine a good chunk of that free space and still run linux smooth?
yes, should work fine - probably up to 4 0r 500 MB should be safe enough for your virtual mcahine
thanks 4 the info, appreciated
no worries :)
of course virtual machines tend to be somewhat slower anyway, as you would realise
